 but without docs
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281

Hey Tom:

Do '$MAVEN_HOME/bin/maven -g' to see possible targets.

For what you're doing, looks like you want '$MAVEN_HOME/bin/maven jar'.  
This will build a heritrix jar into your target directory.

(I just tested with maven rc2 and maven rc1 and the jar target works for 
both. I know that if you try to do any more than build jars, if you want 
to build the doc. or a distribution or generate the heritrix website, 
there'll be probs as has been reported on this list in the past.  Only 
HEAD works for sure with rc2).

Yours,
St.Ack

Tom Emerson wrote:

>Hi,
>
>I grabbed the 0.8.0 sources from CVS and would like to build Heritrix
>under Maven, without having to compile the documentation, since I
>haven't installed sdoc and its dependencies, and really don't want to.
>
>I don't speak Maven at all, so I don't know what goal/taget/whatever-its-called
>to use to build the crawler but not the documentation.
>
>I don't speak Eclipse either --- I'm looking for simplest way to get a
>working build that I can hack on.
>
>Thanks.
>
>    -tree
>
>  
>
